titleStmt.title: James Stuart et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG4242

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
To his Excellency Thomas E. Bramlette
Governor of Kentucky --

Having learned that Mr Franklin Gorin Esq has been indicted in the Jefferson Circuit Court for shooting and wounding Mr W. C. Wood -- that Mr Wood is desirous that no further prosecution shall be had and being satisfied from the circumstances and the known high character of Mr Gorin for generosity and kindness, that the matter ^affair^ was the result of sudden passion, and believing that no public good can result and no public or private injury will result from a dismissal of the prosecution -- We members of the bar of this 4th Judicial District assembled at Brandenburg invoke and pray your Excellency to issue to Mr. Gorin an immediate pardon.
Oct. 26. 1863 --

James Stuart
Circuit Judge
Jno. C. Walker -- atto
Wm Alexander
J B Bruner
W. T. Coale
John L Helm
D. Percefull
G. W. Williams
Jesse W. Kincheloe
